Pre-Game Insights: Padres manager Mike Shildt named Yu Darvish as the starter for Game 5.
Shildt compared the team's approach to an NFL Hall of Fame coach's, emphasizing power sweep and execution.
The Padres and Dodgers have split the NLDS games on their home field.
The Padres went 8-5 against the Dodgers in the regular season, including a split of the season-opening two-game series in South Korea.
The Japanese contingent, including Yu Darvish, Shohei Ohtani, and Yoshinobu Yamamoto, are eager to compete against each other.
